answerText: steroids[10] This steroid's hydroxyl groups bind to the heads of the phospholipids in the cell membrane, decreasing its fluidity. Coming in HDL and LDL varieties, high levels of this compound can cause atherosclerosis.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 13 | 11 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: These compounds are characterized by a 17-carbon four-ring central structure containing three cyclohexane and one cyclopentane ring. For 10 points each: [10] Name these compounds, which include such hormones as estrogen and testosterone.
